title: The undesired horizontal stretch when an item container enclosed by a grid item has grid item around it
author: WeDoTheBest4You
excerpt: When a nested item container surrounded by a grid item as under, it gives the layout as shown below. As expected, it does not stretch horizontally and vertically. import Grid from '@mui/material/...
question_content:
When a nested item container surrounded by a grid item as under, it gives the layout as shown below. As expected, it does not stretch horizontally and vertically.
import Grid from '@mui/material/GridLegacy';

<Grid container>
   <Grid item> /* surrounding grid item */
      <Grid container bgcolor={'red'}> /* nested item container */
         <Grid item>Item around</Grid>
      </Grid>
   </Grid>
</Grid>
Output:
However, when the same nested item container, contains another item container within it, as shown by the below code, it gives the output shown underneath. Unexpectedly, the layout now it produced has a horizontal stretch or some extra space on the right side.
Code 2
 <Grid container>
        <Grid item>
           <Grid container bgcolor={'red'}>
              <Grid item>Item around</Grid>
                <Grid item container bgcolor={'blue'}>
                <Grid item>Item nested</Grid>
              </Grid>
          </Grid>
       </Grid>
    </Grid>
Output:
The expected layout:
The layout I would expect is the below one.
It may be possible to get the desired layout by the following code. The most nested item container is also required to be surrounded by another grid item as shown in the code. This is ok.
Still, i would appreciate if someone can help me to know the reason for the "Code 2" failing to produce the expected layout, or in another words, what would be the reasons for the extra space on the right side of the layout produced by the "Code 2".
  <Grid container>
    <Grid item>
      <Grid container bgcolor={'red'}>
        <Grid item>Item around</Grid>
        <Grid item> /* this surrounds the item container below */
          <Grid item container bgcolor={'blue'}>
            <Grid item>Item nested</Grid>
          </Grid>
        </Grid>
      </Grid>
    </Grid>
  </Grid>
question_code:
import Grid from '@mui/material/GridLegacy';

<Grid container>
   <Grid item> /* surrounding grid item */
      <Grid container bgcolor={'red'}> /* nested item container */
         <Grid item>Item around</Grid>
      </Grid>
   </Grid>
</Grid>

<Grid container>
        <Grid item>
           <Grid container bgcolor={'red'}>
              <Grid item>Item around</Grid>
                <Grid item container bgcolor={'blue'}>
                <Grid item>Item nested</Grid>
              </Grid>
          </Grid>
       </Grid>
    </Grid>

<Grid container>
    <Grid item>
      <Grid container bgcolor={'red'}>
        <Grid item>Item around</Grid>
        <Grid item> /* this surrounds the item container below */
          <Grid item container bgcolor={'blue'}>
            <Grid item>Item nested</Grid>
          </Grid>
        </Grid>
      </Grid>
    </Grid>
  </Grid>

title: OpenStack Swift CLI prefix-based tempurl not working
author: Matthias
question_content:
running
swift tempurl --prefix-based GET 600 "/v1/AUTH_project/container/my/prefix/" "mykey12345"
returns
/v1/AUTH_project/container/my/prefix/?temp_url_sig=abc0987&temp_url_expires=1758927814&temp_url_prefix=test/prefix/
then opening the genreated URL
https://swift.example.com/object/v1/AUTH_project/container/my/prefix/testobject.txt?temp_url_sig=abc0987&temp_url_expires=1758927814&temp_url_prefix=test/prefix/
returns
401 Unauthorized: Temp URL invalid
( running
swift tempurl GET 600 "/v1/AUTH_project/container/my/prefix/testobject.txt" "mykey12345"
and opening the created URL works for the one object )

title: Stripe Embedded Checkout: Default discount code that user can remove?
author: Marving Moréton
excerpt: I’m using Stripe Embedded Checkout and want to apply a discount code automatically when the session starts, but still let the customer remove it if they choose. I passed discounts: [{ promotion_code: ...
question_content:
I’m using Stripe Embedded Checkout and want to apply a discount code automatically when the session starts, but still let the customer remove it if they choose.
I passed discounts: [{ promotion_code: "promo_123" }] when creating the Checkout Session. The discount applies correctly, but the user cannot remove it in the UI. I expected the discount to show up pre-applied with the option to remove it.
Is this supported in Embedded Checkout, or is there a workaround?

title: How to semantically indicate that a webpage is available in multiple languages
author: mattp
excerpt: Is there a standard way that an HTML page written in one (human) language can indicate that a translation is available in another language? I know that I can mark up some text manually, saying ...
question_content:
Is there a standard way that an HTML page written in one (human) language can indicate that a translation is available in another language? I know that I can mark up some text manually, saying something like

This article is also available in Spanish

which will be seen by a user, but I'm wondering whether there is something in pure HTML/CSS that will trigger browser behaviour (in a browser which is suitably aware), similar to the way that some browsers offer to translate a page which may not be in the user's native language. I'm after a solution that works in a stateless way, i.e the translations will be at alternative URLs on a per-language basis, with those translations already having been prepared by me. Note that this mechanism by which a browser offers a translation doesn't fit my needs because a) those are typically machine translations, and b) I wish it to apply in the cases whereby a user might choose to read a page in languages other than their own, as would be the case in a language-learning context. To be clear: I'm not asking about the mechanism by which some sites have a per-user preference for language, such that a given URL will render differently based on the value of that user setting. The solution I'm after needs to work for a static site.
question_code: This article is also available in Spanish

title: CREATE FUNCTION resulting in Unterminated dollar-quoted string error
author: kraemerpw
excerpt: I am posting this question here because I feel like emails I have sent to PostgreSQL mailing lists (pgsql-novice@lists.postgresql.org in particular) have not been going through. I am fairly certain .....
question_content:
I am posting this question here because I feel like emails I have sent to PostgreSQL mailing lists (pgsql-novice@lists.postgresql.org in particular) have not been going through. I am fairly certain that the question below did not get through, but I apologize if anyone has already seen this question....
I am using a HeidiSQL client to query a PostgreSQL database. I find myself very often creating multiple step queries similar to the following where I enter the same dates in multiple places...
WITH q_step_1 AS (
   SELECT .... FROM ...
   WHERE ord_date >= '2024-01-01'),
q_step_2 AS (
   SELECT ... FROM ...
   WHERE inv_date >= '2024-01-01')
SELECT ...
FROM q_step_1
   LEFT JOIN q_step_2 ON .....
I would like to come up with a way that I can define the dates I want in one place, and refer to these definitions in my actual queries.
I am looking into using variables and/or parameters, but the information I found made me believe that in my particular environment, these might not be viable options (please correct me if I am wrong). The most promising option seemed to be creating a FUNCTION similar to the following:
CREATE FUNCTION pk_get_date() RETURNS DATE
   AS $$SELECT '2024-01-01'::DATE;$$
   LANGUAGE SQL IMMUTABLE;
I have tried modifying the above in a number of ways, but I always get the following error:
ERROR: unterminated dollar-quoted string at or near "$$SELECT '2024-01-01'::DATE"
LINE 2: RETURNS DATE AS $$SELECT '2024-01-01'::DATE
If anyone here can suggest how I might be able to get around this error, or suggest a different / better way I can accomplish my objective, I would greatly appreciate it.
question_code:
WITH q_step_1 AS (
   SELECT .... FROM ...
   WHERE ord_date >= '2024-01-01'),
q_step_2 AS (
   SELECT ... FROM ...
   WHERE inv_date >= '2024-01-01')
SELECT ...
FROM q_step_1
   LEFT JOIN q_step_2 ON .....

ERROR: unterminated dollar-quoted string at or near "$$SELECT '2024-01-01'::DATE"
LINE 2: RETURNS DATE AS $$SELECT '2024-01-01'::DATE

title: How to figure out command name for actions in VS for keybinding?
author: Leah T
excerpt: To change/assign the keyboard shortcuts in Visual Studio, you need to know the command name. The options window does support a search and a "Press shortcut keys" experience, but those don't ...
question_content:
To change/assign the keyboard shortcuts in Visual Studio, you need to know the command name.
The options window does support a search and a "Press shortcut keys" experience, but those don't work for every scenario.
sometimes the command name doesn't match the feature/action/menu/window title/etc.
command names aren't always documented
some commands don't have a pre-existing keyboard shortcut
So how else can you find the command name?

title: PostgreSQL Check Constraint or check in stored procedure
author: Francesco Zaffaroni
excerpt: I am working on a data model for recording daily construction work reports in PostgreSQL. A work report is composed by many rows, of three exclusive subtypes: People, Materials and Equipment. Each ...
question_content:
I am working on a data model for recording daily construction work reports in PostgreSQL.
A work report is composed by many rows, of three exclusive subtypes: People, Materials and Equipment.
Each work report is daily and details work performed on one job and has one Foreman.
Currently the data model has the following relevant tables (I am omitting details of the WorkReportRow and subtypes):
Job
+---------------------+
| JobCode          PK |
+---------------------+
| JobName             |
| Address             |
+---------------------+

WorkReport
+---------------------+
| JobCode        PK.1 |
| Date           PK.2 |
+---------------------+
| Foreman          FK | -> To PersonCode in Person table
+---------------------+

Person
+---------------------+
| PersonCode       PK |
+---------------------+
| InsuranceNumber     |
+---------------------+

Role
+---------------------+
| RoleCode         PK |
+---------------------+

PersonRole
+---------------------+
| RoleCode    PK.1 FK | -> to RoleCode in Role table
| PersonCode  PK.2 FK | -> to PersonCode in Person table
+---------------------+
Please note that a person can have more than one role.
I have to enforce a rule where the foreman for each WorkReport is a Person that in the Role has at least Foreman.
Due to the nature of the constraint I'd like for it to be enforced in the database. Ideally I'd add a view called Foreman:
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW Foremen AS
  SELECT p.PersonCode FROM Person p
  JOIN PersonRole pr on p.PersonCode = pr.PersonCode
  WHERE pr.RoleCode = 'Foreman'
And then in the WorkReport table the Foreman FK would point to the Foremen view, the problem is that PostgreSQL apparently doesn't support FK to views.
The two options I see now are:
1. a CHECK constraint in the WorkReport table like this:
ADD CONSTRAINT chk_foreman
CHECK (
  EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM "PersonRole" pr
    WHERE pr."PersonCode" = "WorkReport"."Foreman"
    AND pr."RoleCode" = 'Foreman'
  )
);
I like this solution as it is in the "schema" of the database, therefore impossible to violate, but I don't like to have to per form a query in a check as it looks wasteful.
EDIT: It was correctly pointed out in the comments that CHECK doesn't support queries to other tables in the database. The correct statement defined in the SQL standard would be ASSERTION, which is unfortunately not implemented in any RBDMS. This leaves, without duplicating data with a Foremen table or other data model changes (Subtyped for Person) only the following solution.
2. A check in the stored procedure (current solution)
Due to the need to keep integrity (between WorkReport, WorkReportRow and RowPerson/RowMaterial/RowEquipment) WorkReport insertion is already handled by a stored procedure.
Currently I added this check in the stored procedure:
  SELECT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM "PersonRole"
    WHERE "PersonCode" = P_Foreman
    AND "RoleCode" = 'Foreman'
  ) INTO is_foreman;

  IF NOT is_foreman THEN
    RAISE EXCEPTION 'Error: Person % is not a Foreman.', P_Foreman;
  END IF;
The issue I have with the current implementation is that the check is performed at the Procedure level, and not as a schema constraint, which I think logically would be the best solution.
Do you have any input on this based on the relational model rules and standard?
question_code:
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW Foremen AS
  SELECT p.PersonCode FROM Person p
  JOIN PersonRole pr on p.PersonCode = pr.PersonCode
  WHERE pr.RoleCode = 'Foreman'
